column4: incase anyone is interested .. I have giving the toshiba nb200 netbook a good run for its money with ubuntu and overall Im not happy and will be returning it.
whats wrong with it?
I hate the sound quality of the speakers.  The return key drives me nuts.  And its way too much work to even get the speakers/sound to work in general.  Ohh and the battery life is horrible.
why do you use Ubuntu on it in the first place?..ehhh
was that a serious question?
of course
because I prefer linux over windows
Do you honestly believe there is a distro out there that will properly support that netbooks hardware better then UNR?
why not?
even if there is no *buntu in the name, it should work
you have an nb200?
huh?
its a sound system like Alsa+Pulseaudio. JUst eats less, knows more, works better.. (just supports less hardware).
..ohh thought you were refering to OSS as in a distro.  I got all the hardware to work on the nb200 .. and yes you have to use OSS4 on it.
ah.. so? whats wrong with sound now? OSS should work on it
but then I went to karmic and performed the same steps to get oss up and running etc .. and urg never worked like intrepid or jaunty
why would you use a not-yet-complete distro?
I was hopeing that it would support the sound/wifi better then jaunty did without the annoying steps to patch.
do you have an nb200?  and if so what os/distro do you have running on it?
well.. in such cases, you should just try to use other distro.
how similiar 100,200,2005? .. and did all the hardware work out of the box?
